DataElement.preferredName: FACT-Cog Questionnaire Version 3 CogF25 How Often Past Seven Days Reactions in Everyday Situations Have Been Slow Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A persons' stated observation of how often in the past 7 days their reactions in everyday situations have been slow, using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: FACT-Cognitive Function How Often Past Week Reactions in Everyday Situations Have Been Slow Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The FACT-Cognitive Function questionnaire is a 37 item measure developed by Dr. David Cella to evaluate knowledge and information processing._A question about the frequency of an event or behavior._The most recent week, including today._A question about whether an individual's reactions in everyday situations have been slow._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The FACT-Cognitive Function questionnaire is a 37 item measure developed by Dr. David Cella to evaluate knowledge and information processing.

Concepts.definition: The FACT-Cognitive Function questionnaire is a 37 item measure developed by Dr. David Cella to evaluate knowledge and information processing.

Property.preferredName: How Often Past Week Reactions in Everyday Situations Have Been Slow Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A question about the frequency of an event or behavior.:The most recent week, including today.:A question about whether an individual's reactions in everyday situations have been slow.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A question about the frequency of an event or behavior.
The most recent week. May include the present day.

Concepts.longName: Reactions in Everyday Situations Have Been Slow
Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual's reactions in everyday situations have been slow.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredName: FACT Day Week Frequency Score 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 0 (Never) to 4 (Several Times Daily) on a Likert scale used for FACT questionnaires.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Scheduled or occurring at a frequency of approximately once per week.

Concepts.definition: Scheduled or occurring at a frequency of approximately once per week.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).

Concepts.definition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Two to three times a week

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Two to three times a week
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Scheduled or occurring at a frequency of two or three times per week.

Concepts.definition: Scheduled or occurring at a frequency of two or three times per week.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Scheduled or occurring at a frequency bordering on daily.

Concepts.definition: Scheduled or occurring at a frequency bordering on daily.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Scheduled or occurring at a frequency of several times per day.

Concepts.definition: Scheduled or occurring at a frequency of several times per day.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Link to Scoring and Interpretation Materials
ReferenceDocuments.description: Scoring and Interpretation materials are accessible after registration on the FACIT website.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.
